update.description:
This pull requests improves the overall speed of log playback and test coverage.

* It uses `tinyxml2` in LogPlayback instead of `tinyxml`.
* Adds some new functions to `LogPlay` class: stepback, multi-step, forward, seek.

How to test it:

1. `sudo apt-get install libtinyxml2-dev`
2. Log a long Gazebo log file (+10mins).
3. Close Gazebo and open it again playing back the log file.
4. Play with the log controllers (multi-step, rewind, forward, drag and drop the temporal cursor (seek)).

Everything should be faster than before.

CI results:

* [nogpu happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/729/)
* [Mac OS X happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/563/)
* [trusty nvidia happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/550/) (one error in gz_TEST.cc:634 but it seems unrelated).
update.title: Logging - part2

content.raw: Thanks for looking into this, I don't think it's a problem here.
content.html: Thanks for looking into this, I don't think it's a problem here.

content.raw: `state.log` and `state2.log` have a double pendulum model, while `state3.log` has a much more static world with a few boxes. Probably, when you hit the record button you create a new sample and then, at the end of the current iteration you do it again (both samples have the same sim time but different wall time and states). In the case of `state3.log`, when you hit the record button we create the new sample but it takes a few iterations until the state changes (we moved the box). If the state doesn't change we don't log new samples.
content.html: state.log and state2.log have a double pendulum model, while state3.log has a much more static world with a few boxes. Probably, when you hit the record button you create a new sample and then, at the end of the current iteration you do it again (both samples have the same sim time but different wall time and states). In the case of state3.log, when you hit the record button we create the new sample but it takes a few iterations until the state changes (we moved the box). If the state doesn't change we don't log new samples.

content.raw: Oh I think it's fine the way it is now. I just suggested in case it would be simple.
content.html: Oh I think it's fine the way it is now. I just suggested in case it would be simple.

content.raw: `GetLogStartTime()` only works for the initial start time. We would have to create a function that looks for simulation time in the current sample.
content.html: GetLogStartTime() only works for the initial start time. We would have to create a function that looks for simulation time in the current sample.
